title: Thunderbird 45.0beta Beta

notes.note: Allow editing of From when composing a message.
AB quick search and contacts side bar will search nicknames
Allow copying of name and email address from the message header of an email
Allow printing of individual contacts from context menu
Implement option to always use HTML formatting to prevent unexpected format loss when converting messages to plain text.
Return/Enter in composer will now insert a new paragraph by default (shift-Enter will insert a line break)
Add dropdown in compose to allow specific setting of font size.
Fixed: When sending e-mail which was composed using Chinese, Japanese or Korean characters, unwanted extra spaces were inserted within the text.
Fixed: Drag and drop of multiple attachments failed to OS file folder.
Fixed: Box.com attachments failed to upload.
Fixed: New emails into a mailbox did not adhere to sort order by received.
Fixed: Grouped By view sort direction change was broken, plus enabled custom column grouping.
Linux builds for version 45.0b1 use GTK3, but are not offered for update because GTK2 will be used in future Thunderbird 45 versions. Fixed in 45.0b2.

## Windows

### Operating Systems
 - Windows XP SP3
 - Windows Server 2003 SP1
 - Windows Vista
 - Windows 7
 - Windows 8
 - Windows 10

*Please note that while the 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Windows Vista and Windows 7 can be used to run Thunderbird, only 32-bit builds of Thunderbird are supported at this time.*

  
### Windows Recommended Hardware
   - Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2
   - 1GB RAM
   - 200 MB hard drive space

## GNU/Linux
### Software Requirements
  
  *Please note that Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*
  
- Thunderbird will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
 - GTK+ 2.18 or higher
 - GLib 2.22 or higher
 - Pango 1.14 or higher
 - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
 - libstdc++ 4.3 or higher
 - For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
 - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
 - DBus 1.0 or higher
 - HAL 0.5.8 or higher
 - GNOME 2.16 or higher
